MetaData.MetaDataItem: Adding the device: When the primary controller is set to add/remove modus press the ”INCLUSION” button once on the device

Heatit Z-Din 616 is equipped with 10 relay outputs and 4 analog inputs, and a Z-Wave radio for interfacing to the wireless Z-Wave network. The regulator can be power supplied from a 230V AC mains connection, and is able to deliver an output supply of 24V DC. Heatit Z-Din 616 relay outputs are able to be freely controlled from the Z-Wave network, and can be used for several purposes, e.g. on/off control of light, control of valve actuators for an underfloor heating system, or control of other home automation systems. Heatit Z-Din 616 inputs are analog inputs for interfacing simple temperature sensors; NTC, PT1000, etc. It is possible to configure the level and the indication of the status indicator LED in the front of the Heatit Z-Din 616 regulator.
Removing the device: When the primary controller is set to add/remove modus press the ”INCLUSION” button once on the device

By pressing buttons Right and Center (down and confirm) for 20 seconds, the thermostat will perform a complete factory reset. NB! Please use this procedure only when the primary controller/ gateway is missing or otherwise inoperable.

ChangeLog.Entry: Initial Metadata Import from constructor documentation https://media.heatit.com/1756

Value.label: Status of LED.
Value.Help: Changes the mode of the front-mounted status LED.

Item.label: 2 LED flashing at 1 second intervals (½ Hz)
3 LED flashing at ½ second interval (1 Hz)

Value.label: Brightness of status LED.
Value.Help: Determines the brightness of the status LED.

Value.label: Function setup of input 1
Value.Help: This parameter decides which kind of function is configured to trigger the input.

Value.label: Timer for input 1.
Value.Help: Timer value for input 1, used when input Mode 5 or 6 is chosen. 0 Inactive (default). Time in seconds: 1 – 127. Time in minutes: 128 – 255

Value.label: Function setup of input 2
Value.Help: This parameter decides which kind of function is configured to trigger the input.

Value.label: Timer for input 2.
Value.Help: Timer value for input 2, used when input Mode 5 or 6 is chosen. 0 Inactive (default). Time in seconds: 1 – 127. Time in minutes: 128 – 255

Value.Help: This parameter decides which kind of function is configured to trigger the input.

Value.Help: Timer value for input 3, used when input Mode 5 or 6 is chosen. 0 Inactive (default). Time in seconds: 1 – 127. Time in minutes: 128 – 255

Value.Help: Timer value for input 4, used when input Mode 5 or 6 is chosen. 0 Inactive (default). Time in seconds: 1 – 127. Time in minutes: 128 – 255

Value.Help: This parameter decides which kind of function is configured to trigger the input.

Value.Help: Timer value for input 6, used when input Mode 5 or 6 is chosen. 0 Inactive (default). Time in seconds: 1 – 127. Time in minutes: 128 – 255

Value.label: Input Snubber-filter time constant.
Value.Help: Specifies the time used to define the time constant of the input snubber-filter. (Increments in 0.01 second resolution.)

Value.label: Threshold value for activation of inputs.
Value.Help: Specifies the time that an entry must be stable before it is accepted as active / idle in 0.01 second resolution.

Value.label: Threshold for input in latched mode.
Value.Help: Indicates the time that an input must be activated before it accepts the button latched mode. (Increments in 0.01 second resolution.)

Value.label: Deactivate Central Scene noti-fications.
Value.Help: It is possible to enable Central Scene notifications when the 6 inputs are activated. 0 Central Scene notifications enabled (standard) 1 Central Scene notifications disabled.

Value.label: Output function, Output 1.
Value.Help: Choose parameter value from the table on the right. 0 Output is controlled via Z-Wave messages. 1 Output is controlled by input 1 (standard).

Value.label: Output function, Output 1.
Value.Help: Choose parameter value from the table on the right. 0 Output is controlled via Z-Wave messages. 1 Output is controlled by input 2 (default).

Group.label: Lifeline. - Reset notification - Basic Report On / Off - Multilevel Sensor Report
Basic Set On / Off when input 1 is activated.
Binary Switch Set On / Off when input 1 is activated.
Multilevel Switch Set / Multilevel Switch Start Level Change / Multilevel Switch Stop Level Change when input 1 is activated.
